taskbody.context:
Overview
This procedure provides instructions on how to create a VNF in CBAM.
For more information on CBAM, see CloudBand Application Manager (CBAM) documentation in the Nokia Discovery Center by going to https://doc.networks.nokia.com
Before you begin:
Before beginning this procedure, ensure that you are logged in to the CBAM GUI.To create the VNF:

step.cmd: In the CBAM GUI, click the options button with three horizontal lines, and then select Catalog. The Catalog pane appears.

In the Catalog pane, select the appropriate CSAR package and hover the mouse over the right of the selected line, and then click the Create VNF from Package button represented by the multiple processes icon. The Create New VNF window appears.
In the Create New VNF window, do the following:

li.p: In the Name field, enter the name for this VNF.
If needed, in the Description field, provide additional information about this VNF.

info.p: If the operation succeeds, the new VNF appears in the Virtualized Network Functions pane with the Last Operation Status marked as Completed - Create. If the operation fails, an error message appears in the GUI.

step.cmd: If the operation fails, depending on the cause of failure, you might need to delete the VNF. For example, if you used a wrong CSAR package, then delete the VNF using the procedure . For more information on what to do if this operation fails, see CloudBand Application Manager (CBAM) documentation.
